data.title: seven02 design
data.meta_description: Seven02 is a design studio focused on an insightful and inventive approach to solutions for our clients. We create products, graphics, and interactions that engage, inspire and satisfy people.
data.text:
A soft round form language with a calming monotone color palette is the new look for Transcend’s Micro CPAP family.

The Out-of-box Experience starts with Transcends colorful new branding on the outer sleeve. Upon opening, the product is presented along with the contents list and QR code to get started.

3.6 in diameter x 2.4“ thick (9.1 cm x 6.1 cm) 0.48 lbs (219.5g)

Services:

• Industrial Design

• Out-of-box Experience

• Packaging Design

Working with the Bigfoot team for three plus years we gained a deep understanding and ability to offer meaningful design solutions for their diabetes management system. A truly "design touches all points of the user experience" project.

Start design early was Bigfoot’s insightful vision. To think about solutions for pulling all the disparate elements together at the beginning rather than linearly as a typical project progresses. It’s working backwards, like writing a press release, which describes what it does and why it exists.

The first project was the out-of-box experience for the Welcome Kit. Working with their identity we translated the brand message into the physical appearance for the products and packaging. As they grew we transferred designs to their in-house team for production. We sought to create a design language of soft warm shapes in the product forms. The packaging language expressed their extensive brand color palette.

Bigfoot was acquired by Abbott in 2023.

Services

• Industrial design

• Packaging design

• UI - User Interface design

• UX - User Experience design

• Graphic design IFUs

"FlexiBowl is the packable, stuffable, foldable bowl for eating on the go. Its unique shape allows the upper section to be folded down, so you get to choose between a high bowl or a small bowl/large cup." - from Humangear site.

The diagonal ridges fade in from the bottom and fade out along the top edge suggesting the motion of a collapsing structure.

Industrial design for Humangear.

Industrial design for Ericsson's Mediaroom IPTV platform.

Interacting with the myriad of on-screen services streaming into homes has become sophisticated and complex. The remote was designed with the Mediaroom interface team to harmonize the on-screen experience with the physical interaction.

Navigation

Remotes require a different set of features than phones or tablets. They are used 10 feet away from the screen with features including voice interaction and a set of fixed buttons. The glossy "+" in the center is a pressure sensitive touch surface that allows for fast and fine movement when navigating through menus. The fine dots provide a measured feel radiating from the center. The main function cluster - of the navigation area, You, and OK buttons - is visually linked with a polished gloss finish. Other features such as volume, play, record, etc., are grouped into appropriate clusters.

Form

The overall form is smooth with flush buttons. The rectangular layout spaced on a grid mimics the aesthetic of the TV screen experience.

Services

• Industrial design

Cirle's 3D Surgical Navigation System assists cataract surgeons in mapping the eye.

The smooth flowing form transitions from a simple slab top holding the display to the round base. The cart design positions the touch display at a comfortable height for the surgical assistant.

We worked closely with Cirle's Miami based multi-disciplinary team to meet the schedule from concept to prototypes for a trade show and funding campaign. Cirle granted Bausch + Lomb an exclusive license to commercialize the 3D Surgical Navigation System for cataract surgery.

Services

• Industrial design

• Mechanical engineering support

Recognition

Red Dot Award 2015 Best of the Best

* Firsts > Click here to learn more about our designs for a company's first product

The form fits comfortably in the doctors hand allowing for one-handed operation of rotating and sliding controls.

Ardian developed a catheter-based treatment for hypertension that demonstrates substantial blood pressure reduction. Our design was initially meant as a prototype but the client was so pleased they used it for production - saving them time.

Ardian was acquired by Medtronic. Please see our second project for this division of Medtronic.

Services

• Industrial design

* Firsts > Click here to learn more about our designs for a company's first product

Removing tea from the water at the appropriate time insures a perfectly brewed pot of tea every time.

The patented tea ball rolls out of the water at the prescribed time. The round ball form of the teapot follows the function of the infuser basket in the center of the teapot.

Services Provided

• Industrial design

• Packaging Design

Exhibition

• Exhibited at the San Francisco International Airport SFO Prototype to Product show.

Recognition

• IDSA IDEA Industrial Design Excellence Awards Finalist

• US Patent #7,219,600 B1

* Firsts > Click here to learn more about our designs for a company's first product

Transporters are enterprise class private cloud file sync and share appliances made by Connected Data.

The flowing shape and magical glow of the first Transporter feels like a living sculpture in your office or home.

Seven02 also created the corporate identity and interaction design (see "Connected Data UI and Branding" tile below).

Services

• Industrial design

• Corporate identity

• Packaging design

• Interaction design

• Website design

Advisor

Rick served as an Advisor to Connected Data as they progressed through their start-up phase that included a successful Kickstarter campaign and the launch of the first product Transporter.

Recognition

• Core77 Design Awards The Best of Design 2013

• IDSA / IDEA Finalist (Industrial DesignersSociety of America) 2013

* Firsts > Click here to learn more about our designs for a company's first product

Two vases in one.

The one or a bunch vase displays a single stem or turn it over for a whole bouquet of flowers.

- Ridges make flower arranging easy

- 9" / 230 mm High

- Stacks for storage

- Dishwasher safe

- Durable & recyclable

- Manufactured in the US

The one or a bunch vases are created, designed and produced by seven02. They are molded for us in the US.

They have been sold at retail including the MoMa (NYC), the Brooklyn Museum, Cantor Center at Stanford, High Museum Atlanta, Museum of Fine Arts Boston and Target Online.

Recognition

• Good Design Award

• Spark Design Award

Available in our store

one-or-a-bunch-store

For Sales / Distributors

Email us at info@oneorabunch.com

Two vases in one.

The inward curving sides contrast the center to help position a bunch of flowers outward for a full bouquet and make the vase easy to hold.

Made through the fusion of two formed borosilicate tubes.

This glass version of our award winning one or a bunch vases is currently looking for a distribution partner.

Distribution Inquiries

Email us at info@oneorabunch.com

Our 9” version is currently available at

one-or-a-bunch-store

The understated yet bold look reflects the essence of the entry level plug and play no-frills elements brand. The part line between the top and bottom enclosures is carefully hidden on the underside to give the product a solid feel - as if it was cast out of one piece of material.

The package design incorporates a multi-colored band highlighting key product features such as capacity.

(For all you hard core fans; the gloss sides are a straight pull with draft, no slides).

Services

• Industrial design

• Packaging design language

Product Identity = Brand Identity.

The mysterious and powerful dead-front cover reveals the status and capacity of drobo's automated data storage hardware and software. Drobo's only reveal the number of drives (green LEDs) and capacity (Blue dots) as you store more data.

The air vents are concealed along the part line between the molded gloss end caps and the sheet metal body.

From Drobo's first product (start-up days) we have been responsible for the their look and feel.

Services

• Industrial design

• Interaction design

"...it's dead simple to operate and hides all of its complexity in an attractive, unique, innovative exterior. You couldn't ask for much more from a robot."

-Eric Suesz, Macworld

* Firsts > Click here to learn more about our designs for a company's first product

Designed for and licensed to the Italian door company COCIF Società Cooperativa.

An open door invites people to move between spaces. A closed door says privacy. Luna offers a state of being between open and closed. Luna expands the space between rooms.

Luna is a door with a mysterious character that provides a surprisingly functional feature. The series of holes in the door can be opened and closed which adjusts the amount of light, air and noise between two rooms.

Exhibition

• Designboom "a door to paradise", Milan Design Week 2005 in the historic Triennale.

Recognition

• IDSA / IDEA Industrial Design Excellence Awards - Bronze 2006

• Honorable Mention - Designboom "a door to paradise" design competition

Working with Connected Data to develop the identity of the company that included:

• Identity development & guidelines

• Out-of-Box experience

• Packaging design

• Email notification campaign

• Interaction design of Apps and icons across mulitple platforms (Apple, Windows, iOS, Android and web.

The Connected Data identity expresses motion; the access, sharing and protection of data.

The Connected Data logo has a circle mark with an arrow suggesting forward, backwards and inner motion.

Transporters are private cloud file sync and share appliances made by Connected Data. Check out our industrial design for Connected Data link.

The Lily Pad system is now available with wireless charging for Qi compatible devices (Apple, Samsung, etc.).

Traditional desk grommet cap and liner paired with a unique cable management system allowing easy access to plugs and cables on the surface level. Slots on the grommet liner sort cabling through designated slots and prevent the plugs from slipping down through the table. The elevated platform style cap conceals the cabling and also provides a usable surface space.

Lily's cable management system was combined and integrated into Mockett's EDP/V2 line.

Exhibition

• Exhibited at NeoCon 2012

Recognition

• 26th Annual Doug Mockett Design Competition Winner

• U.S. Patent #9,024,211

Wireless Version Available Here

http://www.mockett.com/new-products-solutions/edp-v2-llqi.html

Other designs for Doug Mockett & Company:

Butler Table Legs

Swan Hook

Y Table Legs

Skydive Table Legs

Diagnostic blood testing analyzers.

ReLIA Analyzer:

The 6-channel benchtop analyzer test up to 6 different patient samples simultaneously. The design goal was to visually align the software to represent what is happening in the physical device. All the information, such as status, type of test, and error messages, for each module is self-contained. The large round front on the device allows for easy pipette access.

ReLIA 3:

Tabletop two tray analyzer user interface screen samples.

ReLIA Mini:

The portable analyzer tests a single patient sample. The GUI had to work within the parameters of the low screen resolution and limited processing power. A hierarchical graphic layout was established for consistent display of instructional messages, type of test, and test results.

Services

• Industrial design

• Interaction design

Rick is a Lecturer in the Communication Design (CD) program at California State University, Monterey Bay (CSUMB). This conceptual poster visualizes a dialogue with a viewer learning about a career in design and the CD program.

@ CSUMB Rick teaches:

HCI / Human Computer Interface. An introductory course on how we interact with our products and services. From User Experience UX, to User Research, down to interactive screen based prototypes.

History of Communication Design. From hieroglyphics to today’s emojis, from the founding of graphic design as a profession, to the changes coming with AI, and all the great brands in between.

Business of Design. Helping students prepare their next step in design; be it a job or graduate school. Covering topics from portfolio, to resumes, budgets (personal and business), running a design studio, proposals, design contracts, and interviews.

You wait. You text. You talk. You make notes.

Jot is a system of lounge seating with an integral tablet surface.

Jot is flexible; left and right chairs combine for numerous solutions.

Recognition

Jot was one of three finalists in the Metropolis Magazine & OFS Brands Furniture HotSeat3 competition.

Jot is seeking a production partner.

More

Lounge and waiting areas are where we open our laptops, check our messages, hold short conversations and make notes. Tablet chairs today are like economy coach seats on an airplane. The sides are tight, the tablet folds over and the table surface is a contrasting material to the body of the chair making it feel like a visual afterthought.

Jot is first class seating; open on one side for easy entry. No need to move your things to get out of the seat. Jot’s tablet flows from the sides and bottom wood material creating one integrated feel. The upholstered seat cushion wraps from the perpendicular direction. The play between the symmetrical cushion and the asymmetrical wood frame leads the user to the open side.

Jot is a fresh approach to the need for full time tablet surfaces in lounge seating.

You ride your bike to town to shop, work, or meet face-to-face.

The “Chat” bike rack symbolizes the physical meeting of people in today’s online world. The two opposing chat bubbles float above the ground creating a lightness to the bike rack. They overlap to further suggest the back and forth of a conversation as well as provide structural integrity to the design.

The City of Los Altos, in partnership with the Public Arts Commission, selected Chat in their bike rack competition.

Chat was built by the City of Los Altos and installed in 2016 at 265 State Street, Los Altos, California.

From the Los Altos City Website:

"This project seeks to add a new element of distinctive public art to City streets and provide an opportunity for the community to think creatively and imaginatively about public streetscapes."
